ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: None
Lots of class participation, very interactive.
Synchronous meeting 3-4 times a week and asynchronous class/practice 1-2 times a week.
just virtual lectures
n/a

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned introductory vocabulary and grammar of Indonesian language.  Also I learned a lot about the different cultures that are present in Indonesia.
Very good and understandable material if you stick with it
I learned a lot about both the Indonesian language and culture.

Began to learn the Indonesian language and culture. Learned lots of vocabulary and the grammatical structure of the language as well as many cultural aspects of Indonesia (food, music, sports, ect...)
I learned a lot about the Indonesian culture and especially about Indonesian culture. Pak Indriyo really taught us well about grammatical structures and how the language is really used.
Basic vocabulary and grammar structures for Indonesian. Can have basic conversations in the language.
I learned a considerable amount of Indonesian, accompanied by a strong understanding of key elements of Indonesian culture.
During this course I learned how to speak basic Indonesian as well as I Indonesian culture itself
developed speaking skills with lots of practice.
I definitely learned a lot about the Indonesian culture and language.
Elementary Indonesian skills. Talking, explaining everyday topics in indonesian

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I wish there was better feedback of our grades throughout the semester.  We did not receive a single grade the whole semester.

You never really know what your grade is in the class. As I am writing this at the end of the semester, they have yet to put one grade into canvas. Great professors that are very passionate and fun language.

The teaching staff (Pak Indriyo and Kak Ganis) made each class very engaging and made the class tasks, such as learning vocabulary, sentence structure, and grammar much more interesting. One way it could be improved is the schedule from week to week, because it was somewhat confusing what was on the agenda for each week.

The strengths of the course were that we were taught the course material at a good pace so that we were able to fully understand the information being presented to us. A weakness was that we never got a grade update throughout the year so no one knew how well or poorly they were doing.
I loved the teacher Pak Indriyo. He was so funny and entertaining and really did a great job of keeping us engaged.
Pak Indriyo is very enthusiastic and makes his students excited to learn.The combination of language and culture is also very interesting.
This course over all was very great. I really enjoyed it. The professors and tas were extremely personable and forgiving considering the circumstances of this year.
Interesting class and helpful class documents to study from. Biggest thing to improve is organization of homework assignments as sometimes the due date was unclear.

I definitely learned a lot and the class environment allowed for a lot of participation and collaboration. The only thing I think could be improved is the communication between professors and students.
Did not ever put in grades.. after this course evaluation is the first time I am seeing my grade.
There are no weaknesses. Pak Indriyo is great.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Language is tough to teach virtually but I thought our professors did a great job keeping us engaged and active.
The class would have been more engaging in person, but the professors did a nice job of adapting to online learning.
The interactive aspects that were constantly used in class helped keep students engaged during the zoom lessons.
The course ran really smoothly even during COVID.
I feel this course was taught the best out of all my courses this semester. From top to bottom.
virtual lectures. Were able to use a lot of videos to learn about Indonesian culture and that made it very fun.

Besides a lack of communication, this course was perfectly designed for covid. There were many opportunities for class-participation and group activities which made learning the content more memorable and enjoyable.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, a great introductory language class with a great professor.  Indonesian is a very interesting language to learn.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it was both very enjoyable and intellectually stimulating.
If you are looking to learn a new language Indonesian is a fun one to learn. The class is fun and interactive and won't kill you on the workload.
The passionate teaching staff is great.
I would 100% recommend this class to another student. The language is interesting, the culture is exciting and the classroom is a supportive space.
Yes because it is a great entry course into Yales curriculum
Very good class that has a relatively light workload but interesting content.

This was a fantastic course taught by a great instructor. If you want to start your day with a fun and engaging course, take this one. You'll be surprised how much Indonesian you'll learn in just a few short months if you put in effort.
I definitely would. It's a fun environment that still promotes learning. The professors are awesome and helpful and you get to form close relationships with your peers.
Yes, the professor is awesome just wish they would of put in grades.
